# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = [""]
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
            current_line_length = 0
        elseif current_line_length > 0
            lines[end] *= " "
            lines[end] *= word
        else
            lines[end] = word
        end
        current_line_length += word_length + 1  # Add 1 for space
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

This function `wrap_string` takes a string `text` and an optional `text_width` parameter, defaulting to 10. It splits the input string into words, loops through them, and adds each word to the appropriate line or creates a new line when the current line width would exceed `text_width`. Finally, it joins the lines together with newline characters and returns the result.
